You can create an Kicking Candlestick Pattern indicator that requires manual update. The following reference table describes the Kicking constructor.

Kicking()1/2

            Kicking QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns.Kicking (
     string  name
   )

Initializes a new instance of the Kicking class using the specified name.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.

Return

Kicking - The new Kicking indicator object.

            Kicking QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns.Kicking (
   )

Initializes a new instance of the Kicking class.

This constructor does not take any argument.

Kicking - The new Kicking indicator object.

Definition at line 54 of file CandlestickPatterns/Kicking.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;

private Kicking _kicking;

// In Initialize()
_kicking = new Kicking(name);
_kicking.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _kicking, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_kicking.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _kicking.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import Kicking
    
# In Initialize()
self.kicking = Kicking(name)
self.kicking.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.kicking, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.kicking.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.kicking.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;
    
private Kicking _kicking;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_kicking = new Kicking();
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _kicking.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_kicking.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _kicking.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import Kicking
    
# In Initialize()
self.kicking = Kicking()
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.kicking.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.kicking.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.kicking.Current.Value
